item.description:
"Earth Day Workshop: Protecting Great Bay "
Join the New Hampshire Coastal Protection Partnership for this
eco-friendly event! Learn how to can take action to reduce
water pollution in Great Bay in your own back yard!

When: Tuesday, April 20 from 7 to 8 PM
Where: Urban Forestry Center Meeting Room - 45 Elwyn Rd.,
Portsmouth, NH 03801

Topics:

1. Lawn fertilizers - Learn how to make eco-friendly decisions
about lawn fertilization, a major source of nitrogen pollution
in Great Bay.

2. Rain Gardens - When it rains, stormwater run-off carries
pollution from leaky septic tanks, pet waste, lawn fertilizers,
and other sources into Great Bay. A rain garden is an eco-
friendly landscaping feature that absorbs and filters
stormwater run-off.

Light snacks and refreshments will be served. The event is free
and open to the public.

We will be accepting voluntary tax-deductible donations to help
support our ongoing efforts to reduce water pollution in the
Great Bay Estuary at the door. Suggested donation: $10

RSVP online at: www.nhcoast.org
item.name: Earth Day Workshop: Protecting Great Bay
